oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Ensiling as a method to preserve energy crops and to enhance the energy yields
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Jaakkola, Seija
Stoddard, Fred
Kym채l채inen, Maritta
Maijala, Pekka
Viikari, Liisa
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Crop husbandry
Environmental aspects
oai_dc:dc.dc:description:
Effects to ethanol: Storing with additives increased the yield of sugars in enzymatic hydrolysis. Water soluble sugars well preserved. Some cellulose hydrolysed during ensiling. Storing altered the structure of the substrate? Suffered from acid formation when no additives were supplied.
Effects to methane: Storing with or without additives increased methane yield. Formed acids were utilized, as well as the preserved water soluble sugars. Prolonged storing seemed to decrease methane yields.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Jaakkola, Seija; Stoddard, Fred; Kym채l채inen, Maritta; Maijala, Pekka and Viikari, Liisa (2011) Ensiling as a method to preserve energy crops and to enhance the energy yields. Food, feed, fuel and fun : Nordic light on future land use and rural development, 24 th NJF congress, Uppsala, Sweden, June 14-16, 2011.
